37b6d754-40c8-44bd-8fa5-c0af7874b160.description: Upon completion of this badge, earners will be fluent in topics of intersectionality and positionality for personal and professional development. Earners will demonstrate an understanding of written works by critical theorists of color and apply this knowledge to everyday life. Earners will also develop a reflexive writing strategy and foster a personal voice of activism.
37b6d754-40c8-44bd-8fa5-c0af7874b160.name: Intersectional Writing

alignments.name: Critical Thinking
alignments.description: Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information.

alignments.name: Equity and Inclusion
alignments.description: Demonstrate the awareness, attitude, knowledge, and skills required to equitably engage and include people from different local and global cultures. Engage in anti-racist practices that actively challenge the systems, structures, and policies of racism.

alignments.name: Communication
alignments.description: Clearly and effectively exchange information, ideas, facts, and perspectives with persons inside and outside of an organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Intersectional Writing course, consisting of ten hours of critical reading and reflection.
Attend one on-campus event that directly correlates with identity and professional development.
Submit two 300-400 word writing samples about personal and professional experiences relating to social identity.
Submit seven reflections connecting course content to everyday life.

91b57d7a-1c2f-420d-9c1a-51360440391c.description: Earners will understand the basics of interviewing and communicating their professional experiences to an interviewer. Earners will be able to effectively answer common interview questions.
91b57d7a-1c2f-420d-9c1a-51360440391c.name: Master Interviewer

alignments.name: Career and Self Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization.

alignments.name: Communication
alignments.description: Clearly and effectively exchange information, ideas, facts, and perspectives with persons inside and outside of an organization.

alignments.name: Professionalism
alignments.description: Knowing work environments differ greatly, understand and demonstrate effective work habits, and act in the interest of the larger community and workplace.

badge_template_activities.title: Watch fifty ten-minute professional video lessons.
Complete eleven quizzes based on video content.
Complete a series of practice interviews to utilize content from videos and quizzes.

9bc4ccfb-2233-4b2b-a8ef-17bfccf75c8b.description: Earners will refine writing skills through PathFinder reflections. Earners will articulate personal values and identify how these values will impact future career plans and goals. Earners will be able to utilize PathFinder reflections as talking points for future interviews.
9bc4ccfb-2233-4b2b-a8ef-17bfccf75c8b.name: PathFinder

alignments.name: Career and Self Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization.

alignments.name: Professionalism
alignments.description: Knowing work environments differ greatly, understand and demonstrate effective work habits, and act in the interest of the larger community and workplace.

alignments.name: Critical Thinking
alignments.description: Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete a series of reflections based on curricular and co-curricular experiences.

c1accdb7-f26a-49d0-9c63-159667353e58.description: Earners will be able to design a basic 3D object, successfully complete a 3D print, and troubleshoot common 3D print errors. Earners apply critical thinking, attention to detail, tinkering skills, and trial-and-error techniques. Earners will learn more about the field and applications of 3D printing and marketable workforce skills.
c1accdb7-f26a-49d0-9c63-159667353e58.name: 3D Printing

alignments.name: Technology
alignments.description: Understand and leverage technologies ethically to enhance efficiencies, complete tasks, and accomplish goals.

alignments.name: Critical Thinking
alignments.description: Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3D Printing online course to learn the fundamentals of the printing process.
Complete 3D printing session with a member of the Albion College Innovation Lab.
Prepare, start, and finish a 3D print.
Complete an assessment on how to troubleshoot 3D printers.
Print a physical three-dimensional 3D Printing Innovation Badge.
Submit a written reflection about the 3D printing process.

56645a7a-6c28-4538-aeb2-7dd12d07f8c4.description: Earners will be able to articulate the importance of attending career events. Earners will understand the importance of professional networking. Earners will create a four-year career development plan.
56645a7a-6c28-4538-aeb2-7dd12d07f8c4.name: Career Management

alignments.name: Career and Self Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization.

alignments.name: Professionalism
alignments.description: Knowing work environments differ greatly, understand and demonstrate effective work habits, and act in the interest of the larger community and workplace.

alignments.name: Communication
alignments.description: Clearly and effectively exchange information, ideas, facts, and perspectives with persons inside and outside of an organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a professional skills assessment in Focus2Career and debrief with the badge administrator.
Attend a career-oriented networking event and submit a written reflection.
Complete a mock interview and submit a written and verbal reflections.
Create professional profiles on LinkedIn and Handshake.
Create a four-year career development plan based on the earner's goals with the support of the Career and Internship Center.

a1156708-05bc-4619-8456-a0b2b505d839.description: Earners will be able to define environmental justice and give examples of environmental issues that impact communities. Earners will assess social vulnerability in communities and analyze past environmental issues in Albion, Michigan through an environmental justice lens. Earners will apply classroom learning about social vulnerability and environmental issues to assess environmental justice in an earner's hometown.
a1156708-05bc-4619-8456-a0b2b505d839.name: Environmental Justice in Albion

alignments.name: Critical Thinking
alignments.description: Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information.

alignments.name: Leadership
alignments.description: Recognize and capitalize on personal and team strengths to achieve organizational goals.

alignments.name: Equity and Inclusion
alignments.description: Demonstrate the awareness, attitude, knowledge, and skills required to equitably engage and include people from different local and global cultures. Engage in anti-racist practices that actively challenge the systems, structures, and policies of racism.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Environmental Justice in Albion course, consisting of six hours of critical reading, analysis, and reflection.
Attend a field trip that provides context to course content about environmental justice in Albion, Michigan.

41a2b019-5dce-4d3a-adc4-4edd64ea28e3.description: Earners will understand the roles of race, ethnicity, sex, gender, and social class in an inclusive society. Earners will understand the importance of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in colleges, universities, and places of employment. Earners will use principles of anti-racism and belonging to write a diversity statement.
41a2b019-5dce-4d3a-adc4-4edd64ea28e3.name: Equity and Inclusion

alignments.description: Demonstrate the awareness, attitude, knowledge, and skills required to equitably engage and include people from different local and global cultures. Engage in anti-racist practices that actively challenge the systems, structures, and policies of racism.

alignments.name: Professionalism
alignments.description: Knowing work environments differ greatly, understand and demonstrate effective work habits, and act in the interest of the larger community and workplace.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Equity and Inclusion online course, consisting of twelve hours of critical reading, analysis, and reflection.
Complete a diversity statement.

635f072a-d4ba-4096-bfab-8fdb88537a04.description: Earners will understand the origins of Race in a United States context. Earners will be able to identify key events and figures in the American Civil Rights Movement. Earners will be able to describe the importance of historical events in shaping racial classifications in contemporary American society.
635f072a-d4ba-4096-bfab-8fdb88537a04.name: Foundations of Race and Belonging

alignments.description: Demonstrate the awareness, attitude, knowledge, and skills required to equitably engage and include people from different local and global cultures. Engage in anti-racist practices that actively challenge the systems, structures, and policies of racism.

alignments.name: Critical Thinking
alignments.description: Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Foundations of Race and Belonging online course, consisting of ten hours of critical reading, analysis, and reflection.

5eafc09a-b4af-43d1-8f86-6c73951226b3.description: Earners will be able to identify the key components of effectively requesting resources for a community project. Earners will be able to write a grant proposal to support a community initiative. Earners will be able to recognize the steps needed to implement a community service project.
5eafc09a-b4af-43d1-8f86-6c73951226b3.name: Grant Writing 101

alignments.description: Recognize and capitalize on personal and team strengths to achieve organizational goals.

badge_template_activities.title: Learn the basics of grant writing.
Write a grant proposal to meet an identified need in the Albion community and present the proposal.
Implement the grant proposal in the Albion community.

2b81e64a-b275-4fd9-a1e6-55e6f1bda98d.description: Earners will be able to identify and respond to injustice. Earners will understand the core concepts of effective advocacy and civic and community engagement. Earners will recognize how to engage with diverse communities through reciprocal and mutually beneficial partnerships.
2b81e64a-b275-4fd9-a1e6-55e6f1bda98d.name: Introduction to Community Engagement

alignments.name: Equity and Inclusion
alignments.description: Demonstrate the awareness, attitude, knowledge, and skills required to equitably engage and include people from different local and global cultures. Engage in anti-racist practices that actively challenge the systems, structures, and policies of racism.

alignments.name: Leadership
alignments.description: Recognize and capitalize on personal and team strengths to achieve organizational goals.

alignments.name: Communication
alignments.description: Clearly and effectively exchange information, ideas, facts, and perspectives with persons inside and outside of an organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Introduction to Community Engagement course, consisting of twelve hours of critical reading, analysis, and reflection.
Complete and pass four quizzes relating to course content.
Submit five assignments related to advocacy, activism, and asset-based thinking and practice.
Submit seven 250 word written reflections connecting course content to everyday life.

d2b73a4e-3de1-4f1f-b3bb-52b130a18b44.description: Earners will understand the ecological footprint concept, calculate their footprints using different calculators, and reflect on different ways to reduce their footprints. Earners will practice taking positive actions to reduce their environmental impacts and understand the value and challenges as individuals and as a society. Earners will also develop and justify a sustainable living pledge.
d2b73a4e-3de1-4f1f-b3bb-52b130a18b44.name: Sustainable Living

alignments.name: Equity and Inclusion
alignments.description: Demonstrate the awareness, attitude, knowledge, and skills required to equitably engage and include people from different local and global cultures. Engage in anti-racist practices that actively challenge the systems, structures, and policies of racism.

alignments.name: Career and Self Development
alignments.description: Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization.

alignments.name: Critical Thinking
alignments.description: Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Sustainable Living course, consisting of twenty hours of critical reading, analysis, and reflection.
Complete three week long Lifestyle Project to experiment with small changes in the earner's lifestyle that are beneficial to the environment.
Write a personal Sustainable Living Pledge that reflects the earner's values and goals.
Participate in discussion with instructor and peers regarding Sustainable Living Pledge and potential revisions.

896b7724-6bb1-488a-8014-a059081f5893.description: Earners will identify behaviors that violate the Albion College Title IX policy and identify methods for reporting Title IX violations. Earners will recall resources on campus and in the local community that are available to survivors of sex-based violence and harassment. Earners will also demonstrate an understanding of the components of healthy relationships and consent.
896b7724-6bb1-488a-8014-a059081f5893.name: Title IX

alignments.description: Clearly and effectively exchange information, ideas, facts, and perspectives with persons inside and outside of an organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an online Title IX training module provided by Vector Solutions.
Complete and pass a quiz related to Title IX training content.
Complete the Healthy Relationships and Consent workshop during Albion-O.
Complete the Green Dot overview training during the earner's First-Year Experience Seminar.
